topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5528719663687274aefd0700#post_5528719663687274aefd0700
Keep in mind that the usa will never go full on progressive though.  All that is really happening is that for the last 15 years we've had a massively social right government.  If there is a drastic shift in policy it's because the government will be representative of the people's center left ideology and not because progressives are taking control of society.

Essentially if you were to say that extremist left is a 0 and extremist right is a 10 the usa would be a 4 and so hypotheticaly if you're hoping it becomes a 0 in the next 20 years or so that's not going to happen; it might become a 3, but there's no way it's going to become a 0 or even a 1.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552873796368727344881500#post_552873796368727344881500
while we won't go full left, we are in terms of social issues pretty far left leaning, most Americans believe in all around equal rights, helping the poor, and the need for social reforms in regards to perception of gender race and sexual identity, we can debate all day over how much we should spend on national parks, i just want us to start disbaring judges who use the fact that a woman was wearing a mini skirt to influence their judgement, and put a mandatory 5 years nor probation prison time on corruption,
